title: French Toast
method: To make French toast, start by whisking together two large eggs, half a cup of milk, one tablespoon of sugar, and a teaspoon of vanilla extract in a shallow dish. Heat a tablespoon of butter in a skillet over medium heat. Dip each slice of bread (preferably day-old) into the egg mixture, coating both sides evenly. Place the bread slices in the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Serve warm with syrup, powdered sugar, or fresh fruit.

title: Caesar Salad
method: To prepare a classic Caesar salad, start by making the dressing. In a small bowl, whisk together one clove of minced garlic, two teaspoons of Dijon mustard, one teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce, two tablespoons of lemon juice, half a cup of mayonnaise, and a quarter cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Slowly drizzle in a quarter cup of olive oil while whisking until the dressing is smooth. In a large bowl, toss chopped romaine lettuce with the dressing. Add croutons and more Parmesan cheese, then toss again to coat evenly. Serve immediately.

title: Scrambled Eggs
method: For simple scrambled eggs, crack three large eggs into a bowl and whisk with a pinch of salt and pepper. Heat a tablespoon of butter in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Pour the eggs into the skillet and let them sit for a few seconds without stirring. Then, gently stir the eggs with a spatula, pushing them from the edges to the center. Continue stirring until the eggs are just set but still soft and creamy. Serve immediately, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

title: Garlic Roasted Potatoes
method: To make garlic roasted potatoes, preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut four medium-sized potatoes into bite-sized cubes and place them in a large bowl. Toss the potatoes with three tablespoons of olive oil, four minced garlic cloves, salt, and pepper to taste. Spread the potatoes out in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
method: To bake classic chocolate chip cookies, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, cream together one cup of softened butter with one cup of sugar and one cup of brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in two large eggs and a teaspoon of vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, whisk together three cups of all-purpose flour, one teaspoon of baking soda, and half a teaspoon of salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in two cups of chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Beef Tacos
method: To make beef tacos, start by heating a tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add one pound of ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks. Drain excess fat, then stir in a packet of taco seasoning along with half a cup of water. Simmer the beef mixture for about 5 minutes, until the sauce has thickened. Warm your taco shells according to package instructions. Fill each shell with the beef mixture and top with your favorite toppings, such as shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, and sour cream. Serve immediately.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
method: To prepare a vegetable stir-fry, heat two tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add two cloves of minced garlic and a teaspoon of grated ginger, cooking for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add your choice of vegetables, such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and snap peas, cut into bite-sized pieces. Stir-fry the vegetables for about 5-7 minutes, until they are tender-crisp. In a small bowl, mix together two tablespoons of soy sauce, one tablespoon of oyster sauce, and one teaspoon of cornstarch. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another minute until the sauce thickens slightly. Serve hot over steamed rice.

title: Classic Hummus
method: To make classic hummus, start by draining and rinsing one 15-ounce can of chickpeas. In a food processor, combine the chickpeas with a quarter cup of tahini, two tablespoons of olive oil, two tablespoons of lemon juice, one clove of garlic, and half a teaspoon of ground cumin. Process until smooth, adding a few tablespoons of water if the hummus is too thick. Season with salt to taste. Transfer the hummus to a serving bowl, drizzle with a little more olive oil, and garnish with paprika or fresh parsley. Serve with pita bread or fresh vegetables.

title: Fruit Smoothie
method: To make a fruit smoothie, combine one cup of your favorite fresh or frozen fruit (such as berries, mango, or banana) with half a cup of yogurt, half a cup of milk or juice, and a tablespoon of honey in a blender. Blend until smooth, adding more liquid if needed to reach your desired consistency. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy immediately. For an extra nutritional boost, you can add a handful of spinach or a scoop of protein powder to the blender before blending.

title: Roast Chicken
method: To prepare a simple roast chicken, preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Rinse a whole chicken and pat it dry with paper towels. Rub the chicken with two tablespoons of olive oil and season generously with salt, pepper, and any other desired herbs, such as thyme or rosemary. Place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan, breast side up. Roast in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) and the skin is golden brown. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

title: BLT Sandwich
method: To make a classic BLT sandwich, start by cooking 4 slices of bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. While the bacon cooks, toast 2 slices of bread until golden brown. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread. On one slice, layer 2-3 leaves of lettuce, 2 slices of tomato, and the cooked bacon. Season the tomato slices with salt and pepper to taste. Top with the second slice of bread, mayonnaise side down. Slice the sandwich in half and serve immediately.

title: Caprese Salad
method: For a simple Caprese salad, start by slicing 2-3 ripe tomatoes and 1 large ball of fresh mozzarella into even slices. Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving plate, slightly overlapping each slice. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices. Drizzle the salad with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately, either as a side dish or a light appetizer.

title: Chicken Quesadilla
method: To make a chicken quesadilla, start by heating a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add 1 cup of cooked, shredded chicken and sprinkle with taco seasoning or your favorite spices. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring, until the chicken is heated through. Place a large flour tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle one half with a handful of shredded cheese. Add the seasoned chicken on top of the cheese, then fold the tortilla in half. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Slice into wedges and serve with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole.

title: Greek Salad
method: To make a Greek salad, start by chopping 2 large tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 1 green bell pepper, and 1 small red onion into bite-sized pieces. Place the chopped vegetables in a large bowl. Add a handful of pitted Kalamata olives and a block of feta cheese, crumbled or cut into cubes. Drizzle the salad with extra virgin olive oil and a squeeze of lemon juice. Season with salt, pepper, and dried oregano. Toss everything together gently to combine. Serve immediately as a side dish or light meal.

title: Vanilla Pudding
method: To make homemade vanilla pudding, start by whisking together 2/3 cup of sugar, 1/4 cup of cornstarch, and a pinch of salt in a medium saucepan. Gradually whisk in 2 cups of milk until smooth. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it begins to thicken and bubble. Reduce the heat to low and continue cooking for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Pour the pudding into individual serving dishes and let it cool to room temperature before refrigerating for at least 2 hours. Serve chilled.

title: Tomato Bruschetta
method: To make tomato bruschetta, start by dicing 4-5 ripe tomatoes and placing them in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil, 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and a handful of chopped fresh basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir everything together and let the mixture sit for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Meanwhile, slice a baguette into thin slices and toast them in the oven until lightly golden. Spoon the tomato mixture onto each slice of toasted baguette just before serving. Drizzle with a little more olive oil if desired.

title: BBQ Chicken Wings
method: To make BBQ chicken wings, start by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). Place 2 pounds of chicken wings in a large bowl and toss them with 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the wings out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the wings are golden brown and crispy. Remove the wings from the oven and toss them in your favorite BBQ sauce. Return the wings to the oven for an additional 5 minutes to allow the sauce to set. Serve hot, with extra sauce on the side.

title: Spinach and Feta Omelette
method: To make a spinach and feta omelette, start by whisking 3 large eggs in a bowl with a pinch of salt and pepper. Heat a tablespoon of butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add a handful of fresh spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. Pour the eggs over the spinach, tilting the skillet to spread them evenly. Cook until the edges start to set, then sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over one half of the omelette. Fold the other half of the omelette over the cheese and cook for another minute, until the eggs are fully set and the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

title: Vegetable Soup
method: To make a hearty vegetable soup, start by heating 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 sliced carrots, and 2 chopped celery stalks. Cook the vegetables for 5-7 minutes, until they begin to soften. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and cook for another minute. Pour in 4 cups of vegetable broth and bring the soup to a boil. Add 1 diced potato, 1 cup of chopped green beans, and 1 can of diced tomatoes with their juice. Season with salt, pepper, and a teaspoon of dried thyme. Reduce the heat and simmer the soup for 20-25 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. Stir in a handful of chopped fresh parsley before serving.

title: Macaroni and Cheese
method: To make classic macaroni and cheese, start by cooking 2 cups of elbow macaroni in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain the pasta and set it aside. In the same pot, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Stir in 2 tablespoons of flour to form a roux, cooking for about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in 2 cups of milk, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens. Remove the pot from heat and stir in 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese until melted and smooth. Add the cooked macaroni to the sauce, stirring to coat the pasta evenly. Serve hot, optionally topped with breadcrumbs and baked until golden.

title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
method: To make a grilled cheese sandwich, start by buttering one side of two slices of bread. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Place one slice of bread, buttered side down, in the skillet. Add 2-3 slices of your favorite cheese on top. Cover with the other slice of bread, buttered side up. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately, often accompanied by a bowl of tomato soup.

title: Pancakes
method: To make pancakes, whisk together 1 cup of flour, 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and a pinch of salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 cup of milk, 1 egg, and 2 tablespoons of melted butter. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined; a few lumps are okay. Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with butter or oil. Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake onto the skillet. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until the other side is golden brown. Serve warm with syrup and butter.

title: Chicken Alfredo
method: To make chicken Alfredo, start by cooking 2 chicken breasts in a large skillet over medium heat with a tablespoon of olive oil, seasoning them with salt and pepper. Cook for about 7-8 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, melt 3 tablespoons of butter and add 2 cloves of minced garlic, cooking for 1 minute. Pour in 1 cup of heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in 1 cup of grated Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth. Slice the cooked chicken and return it to the skillet along with cooked fettuccine pasta. Toss everything together and serve hot.

title: Guacamole
method: To make guacamole, start by mashing 2 ripe avocados in a bowl. Add 1 small diced onion, 1 diced tomato, 1 minced jalapeño, and a handful of chopped cilantro. Stir in the juice of 1 lime and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix everything together until well combined. Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos and burritos.

title: Banana Bread
method: To make banana bread, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, mash 3 ripe bananas with a fork. Stir in 1/3 cup of melted butter, 1/2 cup of sugar, 1 beaten egg, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 1/2 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and a pinch of salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined. Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan and bake for 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
method: To make chicken noodle soup, start by heating 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 sliced carrots, and 2 chopped celery stalks. Cook the vegetables for 5-7 minutes until softened. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and cook for another minute. Pour in 6 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add 2 cups of shredded cooked chicken and 2 cups of egg noodles. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10-12 minutes, until the noodles are tender. Season with salt, pepper, and a handful of chopped fresh parsley. Serve hot, with crackers or bread on the side.

title: Egg Fried Rice
method: To make egg fried rice, start by heating 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add 3 beaten eggs and scramble until fully cooked. Remove the eggs from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of oil and stir-fry 2 cups of cold, cooked rice for 2-3 minutes. Add 1 cup of mixed vegetables (like peas, carrots, and corn) and cook for another 2 minutes. Return the scrambled eggs to the skillet and stir in 2 tablespoons of soy sauce and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil. Cook everything together for another minute. Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
method: To make spaghetti carbonara, start by cooking 8 ounces of spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. While the pasta cooks, fry 4 ounces of diced pancetta or bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. In a small bowl, whisk together 2 large eggs and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Drain the pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water. Return the pasta to the pot and quickly stir in the egg mixture, tossing to coat the pasta evenly. Add the crispy pancetta and a splash of the reserved pasta water if the sauce is too thick. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately, topped with extra Parmesan.

title: Minestrone Soup
method: To make minestrone soup, start by heating 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 chopped carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften. Stir in 2 minced garlic cloves and 1 diced zucchini, cooking for another 2 minutes. Add 1 can of diced tomatoes, 4 cups of vegetable broth, 1 can of kidney beans, and 1/2 cup of small pasta (like ditalini). Season with salt, pepper, and a teaspoon of dried oregano. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the pasta is cooked. Stir in a handful of chopped spinach before serving.

title: Blueberry Muffins
method: To make blueberry muffins, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners. In a large bowl, whisk together 1 1/2 cups of flour, 3/4 cup of sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 2 teaspoons of baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine 1/3 cup of vegetable oil, 1 large egg, and 1/3 cup of milk. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Gently fold in 1 cup of fresh or frozen blueberries. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
method: To make stuffed bell peppers, start by preheating your oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off 4 bell peppers and remove the seeds. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cooking until softened. Stir in 1 pound of ground beef and cook until browned. Drain any excess fat. Add 1 cup of cooked rice, 1 can of diced tomatoes, salt, pepper, and a teaspoon of Italian seasoning. Stuff each bell pepper with the beef mixture and place them in a baking dish. Top with shredded cheese and cover with foil. Bake for 25-30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and golden.

title: Beef Stroganoff
method: To make beef stroganoff, start by cutting 1 pound of beef sirloin into thin strips. Season the beef with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned, about 4-5 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, melt another 2 tablespoons of butter and sauté 1 diced onion and 1 clove of minced garlic until softened. Stir in 1 tablespoon of flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add 1 cup of beef broth and 1 cup of sour cream, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens. Return the beef to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Serve over egg noodles, garnished with fresh parsley.

title: Chicken Parmesan
method: To make chicken Parmesan, preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Start by seasoning 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Dredge each chicken breast in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and finally coat with breadcrumbs mixed with grated Parmesan cheese. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Cook the chicken for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and top with marinara sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot over spaghetti or your favorite pasta.

title: Apple Pie
method: To make apple pie, start by preheating your oven to 425°F (220°C). In a large bowl, combine 6 peeled and sliced apples with 1/2 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Toss the apples to coat them evenly. Roll out a pie crust and fit it into a 9-inch pie dish. Pour the apple mixture into the crust and dot with 2 tablespoons of butter. Roll out the second pie crust and place it over the apples, crimping the edges to seal. Cut a few slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly. Let the pie cool before serving.

title: Vegetarian Chili
method: To make vegetarian chili, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 chopped bell peppers, and 2 minced garlic cloves. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons of chili powder, 1 teaspoon of cumin, and 1 teaspoon of smoked paprika. Add 1 can of diced tomatoes, 1 can of kidney beans, 1 can of black beans, and 1 cup of vegetable broth. Bring the chili to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with sour cream, shredded cheese, and chopped cilantro.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
method: To make eggplant Parmesan, start by preheating your oven to 375°F (190°C). Slice 2 medium eggplants into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Season the slices with salt and let them sit for 30 minutes to draw out excess moisture. Pat the eggplant slices dry with paper towels. Dredge each slice in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat and fry the eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides. In a baking dish, layer the fried eggplant slices with marinara sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese. Repeat the layers until all the ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

title: Pulled Pork Sandwiches
method: To make pulled pork sandwiches, start by rubbing a 3-4 pound pork shoulder with a mixture of salt, pepper, paprika, and brown sugar. Place the pork in a slow cooker and add 1 cup of barbecue sauce and 1/2 cup of apple cider vinegar. Cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until the pork is tender and easily shredded. Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred it with two forks. Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker and toss with the cooking juices. Serve the pulled pork on toasted buns with coleslaw and extra barbecue sauce on the side.

title: Tiramisu
method: To make tiramisu, start by brewing 1 cup of strong coffee and letting it cool. In a large bowl, beat 4 egg yolks with 1/2 cup of sugar until thick and pale. Add 8 ounces of mascarpone cheese and mix until smooth. In a separate bowl, whip 1 cup of heavy cream until stiff peaks form, then fold it into the mascarpone mixture. Dip each ladyfinger into the cooled coffee, then layer them in a 9x9-inch dish. Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers, then repeat with another layer of soaked ladyfingers and the remaining mascarpone mixture. Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

title: Lasagna
method: To make lasagna, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Start by cooking 12 lasagna noodles according to package instructions. In a large skillet, brown 1 pound of ground beef with 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves. Drain any excess fat, then stir in 1 jar of marinara sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup of ricotta cheese with 1 beaten egg and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. To assemble the lasagna, spread a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of a baking dish. Layer 3 noodles over the sauce, then spread with a third of the ricotta mixture and sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese. Repeat the layers, ending with a final layer of meat sauce and mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Let the lasagna cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
method: To make classic chocolate chip cookies, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter, 1 cup of white sugar, and 1 cup of brown sugar until smooth. Beat in 2 eggs, one at a time, then stir in 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, whisk together 3 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the wet mixture. Fold in 2 cups of semisweet chocolate chips. Drop tablespoon-sized balls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Beef Tacos
method: To make beef tacos, start by cooking 1 pound of ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat, then stir in 1 packet of taco seasoning mix and 1/2 cup of water. Simmer the mixture for 5 minutes, or until the sauce thickens. Warm taco shells in the oven or microwave, then fill each shell with a spoonful of the beef mixture. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, and a dollop of sour cream. Serve immediately with salsa and guacamole on the side.

title: Chocolate Cake
method: To make a moist chocolate cake, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, stir together 2 cups of sugar, 1 3/4 cups of flour, 3/4 cup of cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Add 2 eggs, 1 cup of milk, 1/2 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Beat the mixture on medium speed for 2 minutes. Stir in 1 cup of boiling water (the batter will be thin). Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely before frosting.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
method: To make chicken stir-fry, start by slicing 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts into thin strips. In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of soy sauce, 2 tablespoons of hoisin sauce, 1 tablespoon of rice vinegar, and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, stir-fry 1 sliced bell pepper, 1 sliced carrot, and 1 cup of broccoli florets for 3-4 minutes. Return the chicken to the skillet and pour the sauce over everything. Stir to coat and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Serve hot over steamed rice.

title: Garlic Bread
method: To make garlic bread, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of softened butter, 3 minced garlic cloves, and 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley. Cut a loaf of French bread in half lengthwise. Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly over the cut sides of the bread. Place the bread halves on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden and crispy. For extra cheesy garlic bread, sprinkle shredded mozzarella or Parmesan cheese over the top and bake for an additional 3-5 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Slice and serve warm.

title: Greek Salad
method: To make a fresh Greek salad, start by chopping 4 large tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 1 red onion, and 1 green bell pepper. Place the vegetables in a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup of Kalamata olives and 1/4 cup of crumbled feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon of dried oregano, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately as a side dish or light meal.

title: Fish Tacos
method: To make fish tacos, start by seasoning 1 pound of white fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia) with salt, pepper, and a pinch of chili powder. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Cook the fish fillets for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the fish from the skillet and break into large pieces. Warm corn tortillas in the oven or microwave, then fill each tortilla with a few pieces of fish. Top with shredded cabbage, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, and a drizzle of lime crema (made by mixing sour cream with lime juice and zest). Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

title: Chicken Caesar Wrap
method: To make a chicken Caesar wrap, start by grilling or pan-searing 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts until fully cooked. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes, then slice it into thin strips. In a large bowl, toss the chicken with 1/4 cup of Caesar dressing, 2 cups of chopped romaine lettuce, and 1/4 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Lay out large flour tortillas and place a portion of the chicken mixture in the center of each. Fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then roll it up tightly. Slice in half and serve immediately.

title: Baked Ziti
method: To make baked ziti, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook 1 pound of ziti pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside. In a large skillet, brown 1 pound of Italian sausage over medium heat, breaking it up into small pieces. Stir in 1 jar of marinara sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the cooked ziti with the sausage mixture, 1 cup of ricotta cheese, and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and top with 2 cups of shredded mozzarella cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Let the ziti cool for a few minutes before serving.

title: Pumpkin Pie
method: To make pumpkin pie, preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). In a large bowl, whisk together 2 cups of canned pumpkin puree, 1 can of sweetened condensed milk, 2 large eggs, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1/4 teaspoon of ground cloves, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Pour the mixture into an unbaked 9-inch pie crust. Bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 35-40 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Let the pie cool completely before serving with whipped cream.

title: Kimchi Jigae
method: To make Kimchi Jigae, start by heating 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1/2 pound of pork belly or shoulder, sliced thinly, and cook until browned. Stir in 2 cups of well-fermented kimchi and cook for 3-4 minutes until the kimchi is softened. Add 4 cups of water or broth, 1 tablespoon of gochujang (Korean red chili paste), and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add 1 block of tofu, cut into cubes, and simmer for another 5-10 minutes. Serve the stew hot, garnished with chopped green onions and a bowl of steamed rice on the side.
